description.plain:
Troye Sivan is a South-African born Australian artist. His manager found him at a young age through his personal YouTube channel which as of August 2020, has more than 7.45 million subscribers. He went on to star in X-Men Origins: Wolverine and the Spud film trilogy.

In 2013, he wrote and released an original song, “The Fault In Our Stars”, which earned him a record deal with EMI Australia, a major label under Universal. The next year, he released the TRXYE – EP  which debuted at number 5 on the Billboard 200.

On July 25, 2015, Sivan announced his second major-label EP, Wild. Wild preceded the release of his debut album, Blue Neighbourhood, several months later. All Wild songs featured in at least one edition of Blue Neighbourhood.

Blue Neighbourhood was successful worldwide, peaking at #7 on the 2015 Billboard 200. “Youth” was released in November 2015 as the album’s second single and sold 1 million copies in the US, becoming Platinum.

Troye released Bloom, his sophomore studio album, on August 31st, 2018. The album received commercial and critical success, debuting at #4 on the Billboard Charts and landing spots on the album of the year lists from Time, The Guardian, and more. In 2020, he also released his IN A DREAM EP amidst a global pandemic.

Troye opened 2021 by releasing “YOU” on April 16, which was a collaborative effort with Tate McRae and DJ Regard. It would maintain the triumph of being pop radio’s most added song in the wake of its debut. In June, Troye would also put out the full version of the 50-second track “could cry just thinkin about you.”

In 2013, he wrote and released an original song, “The Fault In Our Stars”, which earned him a record deal with EMI Australia, a major label under Universal. The next year, he released the TRXYE – EP  which debuted at number 5 on the Billboard 200.

On July 25, 2015, Sivan announced his second major-label EP, Wild. Wild preceded the release of his debut album, Blue Neighbourhood, several months later. All Wild songs featured in at least one edition of Blue Neighbourhood.

Blue Neighbourhood was successful worldwide, peaking at #7 on the 2015 Billboard 200. “Youth” was released in November 2015 as the album’s second single and sold 1 million copies in the US, becoming Platinum.

Troye released Bloom, his sophomore studio album, on August 31st, 2018. The album received commercial and critical success, debuting at #4 on the Billboard Charts and landing spots on the album of the year lists from Time, The Guardian, and more. In 2020, he also released his IN A DREAM EP amidst a global pandemic.

Troye opened 2021 by releasing “YOU” on April 16, which was a collaborative effort with Tate McRae and DJ Regard. It would maintain the triumph of being pop radio’s most added song in the wake of its debut. In June, Troye would also put out the full version of the 50-second track “could cry just thinkin about you.”

songs.full_title: YOUTH by Troye Sivan
songs.title: YOUTH

description.plain:
“Youth” is a song from the debut album by Troye Sivan, Blue Neighbourhood, which was released on the 4th of December, 2015. It debuted on Apple Music on 12 November 2015.

When describing the song Troye says:

Youth is the fantasy of finding someone that makes you feel like half a person. It’s all about the joy, and naivety, and being lost. It’s about dropping everything and running away, making mistakes, loving too hard, and how that’s okay even when it’s not.

Although the track serves mainly as a love story, “YOUTH” could also represent Troye’s love song for his fans. Troye began his career in entertainment at a young age, essentially growing up under the public eye.

100 ContributorsYOUTH Lyrics[Verse 1]
What if, what if we run away?
What if, what if we left today?
What if we said goodbye to safe and sound?
And what if, what if we're hard to find?
What if, what if we lost our minds?
What if we let them fall behind and they're never found?

[Pre-Chorus]
And when the lights start flashing like a photobooth
And the stars exploding, we’ll be fireproof

My youth, my youth is yours
Trippin' on skies, sippin' waterfalls
My youth, my youth is yours
Runaway now and forevermore
My youth, my youth is yours
A truth so loud you can't ignore
My youth, my youth, my youth
My youth is yours

[Verse 2]
What if, what if we start to drive?
What if, what if we close our eyes?
What if we're speeding through red lights into paradise?
Cause we've no time for getting old
Mortal body; timeless souls
Cross your fingers, here we go
You might also like[Pre-Chorus]
And when the lights start flashing like a photobooth
And the stars exploding, we’ll be fireproof

[Chorus]
My youth, my youth is yours
Trippin' on skies, sippin' waterfalls
My youth, my youth is yours
Runaway now and forevermore
My youth, my youth is yours
A truth so loud you can't ignore
My youth, my youth, my youth
My youth is yours

[Outro]
My youth, my youth is yours
Trippin' on skies, sippin' waterfalls
My youth, my youth is yours
Runaway now and forevermore
My youth, my youth is yours
A truth so loud you can't ignore
My youth, my youth, my youth
My youth is yours
My youth is yours
My youth is yours94Embed

songs.full_title: My My My! by Troye Sivan
songs.title: My My My!

description.plain:
On “My My My!,” Troye Sivan is at his most confident, with lyrics that tap into themes of freedom, sexuality, and living in the moment. It’s the first single since his 2015 album Blue Neighbourhood, and is accompanied by a flashy music video drawing inspiration from Madonna’s “Justify My Love”-era visuals (Troye is a big fan).

Troye started posting teaser videos for “My My My!” on January 4, 2018, and a countdown for the release appeared in Times Square soon after. Four days later, he teased the title of the song on Twitter along with a picture of hot air balloon that he had taken on the same day he recorded the track in June 2017.

songs.full_title: Bloom by Troye Sivan
songs.title: Bloom

description.plain:
“Bloom” is the second single and title track from Troye Sivan’s upcoming sophomore album, Bloom, being preceded by “My My My!”.

The song was revealed in an interview with Dazed magazine, and described as a gay anthem with sexual undertones about “the receptive partner losing his virginity”.

The song was teased for the first time on April 22nd, 2018 on Twitter, when Troye tweeted a flower emoji, growing speculation that this was referring to the song. On April 30th, he revealed the release of his mobile app along with a short teaser of the song and the release date:
https://twitter.com/troyesivan/status/990976648387313666

songs.embed_content: Read “Bloom” by Troye Sivan on Genius
